p: In addition, an interesting combination of two drugs was suggested [ 69]. For more than 50 years, xylometazoline has been used to relieve vasoconstriction and oedema of the nasal mucosa in acute respiratory viral infections caused by a wide variety of respiratory viruses, including the influenza virus. The authors combined this vasoconstrictor and ı-carrageenan in one preparation, which had an antiviral effect. It was found that the polysaccharide did not reduce the efficacy and safety of xylometazoline, and the antiviral efficacy of ı-carrageenan remained unchanged.
